	Sourcing &amp; Negotiation: Researching and evaluating potential IT vendors, negotiating prices and terms for hardware, software, and IT services to get the best value.

	Software Proficiency: Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly for record-keeping and analysis, and specialized procurement software.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month.

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Our facility is a modern hospital established with the primary aim of meeting the medical needs of the Nigerian public who have for long yearned for a hospital that puts quality care at the centre of its business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Officer
Job Location: Magodo Phase 2, Shangisha - Lagos

Job Responsibilities

	Manage client experience, ensuring satisfaction through timely delivery of service to maximize client retention.
	Ensure quality service and constantly monitor levels of service quality, and devise strategies to improve any shortfalls.
	Communicate effectively and build strong relationships with key stakeholders, including partners, clinical teams, suppliers, strategic partners, and external advisors.
	Compile accurate weekly management reports as required.
	Oversee all day-to-day operations of the administration functions and maintain a healthy administrative system of the Hospital.
	Work with the GM and other members of the administrative team in the generation and management of a sustainable pipeline of work that reflects the current and anticipated administrative strategy and business plans
	Organize and coordinate operations in ways that ensure maximum efficiency and effectiveness.
	Assess overall administrative performance against set objectives.
	Ensuring that all the facilities of the hospital are properly maintained in line with health and safety policies
	Responsible for ensuring the hospital wards are properly arranged and conducive.
	Ensuring the office is stocked with necessary supplies and that all equipment is working and properly maintained.
	Ensure safety in the Hospital by making sure that security is alert to their job.
	Management of waste disposal.
	Provide standard clerical duties as assigned, including mailing, and communicating with clients and partners.
	Nurture a positive working environment and develop strong relationships with cross-functional teams and departments.
	Ensure legal compliance throughout administrative management.
	Perform any other duties from higher authority.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc / HND Degree in accounting / management courses
	Minimum of 2 years of work experience
	Age limit, (Under 35yrs)
	Resident in Lagos(Around Magodo phase 2)
	Good communication skills
	Computer skills
	Must be willing to do night shift.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: olushola.magodospecialisth@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Please indicate your location and age in your CV

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Personal Assistant / Secretary to the Managing Director",
  "description": "Nutrivitas Limited is incorporated to standardize the feed additives subsector of the Nigerian Feed/Livestock industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant / Secretary to the Managing Director

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	In this role as a Personal Assistant to the Managing Director, you will be responsible for providing administrative support in a professional and confidential manner.
	You will manage the MD&rsquo;s calendar, coordinate meetings and travel arrangements, handle correspondence, and assist in preparing reports and presentations.
	Your exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritize tasks will be instrumental in ensuring the smooth operation of the MD&rsquo;s office.
	As a Personal Assistant, you will also be expected to maintain a strong level of discretion and confidentiality in handling sensitive information.

title: Job Vacancies at Sky Mall
content:
Sky Mall is a family-friendly destination for entertainment, leisure and shopping, situated on Lekki-Epe Expressway in the Sangotedo axis of Lagos. It is home to various brands and businesses offering top quality goods and services on a daily basis.


Sky Mall is divided into two sections: the main Shopping mall for shopping and recreation, and the Extension section which offers office spaces. The mall boasts an opulent decor and wide of range of shops, office spaces, warehouses, top-notch restaurants, exclusive VIP lounges, cinemas, and a terrace bar.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We provide easy movements from the ground floor to the top floor of the mall by stationing two elevators and three escalators within the shopping mall. There is also a cargo lift that runs from the ground floor to the third floor at the Extension part of the mall.


We provide our tenants with an official parking lot strictly for business operators in the mall, and also we provide a well-secured car park for customers which can can accommodate more than 300 cars.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Cost Accountant

Job Location: Sangotedo, Eti-Osa - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Results Areas / Accountabilities
Cost Analysis:


	Conduct detailed analysis of manufacturing costs, including direct labor, direct materials, and overhead expenses.
	Regularly review and update cost estimates for new and existing products vs expectations.
	Analyse variances between actual and standard costs, identifying and investigating any discrepancies.
	Regularly review the BOM to ensure accuracy with what is happening on the production floor.


Inventory Management:


	Oversee the valuation of inventory and ensure accurate recording in the financial statements.
	Collaborate with the production team to reconcile physical inventory with accounting records.
	Observe and review the inventory processing procedures regularly i.e. Receiving, Inter-warehouse transfers, daily production reconciliation, issues to production etc.
	Implement and maintain effective inventory control measures.


Financial Reporting:


	Prepare and present regular financial reports related to manufacturing costs to management.
	Provide insights and recommendations based on cost analysis to support strategic decision-making.
	Assist in the preparation of budgets and forecasts related to manufacturing activities.


Month-end Close:


	Play a key role in the month-end closing process, ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting.
	Reconcile general ledger accounts related to manufacturing costs.
	Process Improvement:
	Identify opportunities for cost reduction and operational efficiency within the manufacturing process.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement process improvements and cost-saving initiatives.


Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with relevant accounting standards and regulations.
	Assist in internal and external audits related to manufacturing costs.


Communication and Collaboration:


	Collaborate with various departments, including production, procurement, and finance, to gather relevant cost information.
	Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders, providing insights and answering inquiries related to manufacturing costs.


Must have knowledge of:


	Accounting software and ERP systems (Sage 200 Evolution v9)
	Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Strong Analytical skills: essential for accurate financial data analysis
	Strong Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to identify issues, analyse situations, and develop practical solutions to address challenges.
	Attention to Detail: to ensure accuracy and integrity of information.
	Working under Pressure: ability to work under tight deadlines.
	Communication Skills: excellent verbal and written skills
	Organizational Skills: Ability to maintain structured workflows to ensure smooth business operations.
	Interpersonal Skills: Strong interpersonal abilities to build positive relationships with
	colleagues, and clients, fostering a welcoming and inclusive environment.
	Teamwork: to collaborate effectively with diverse teams to achieve common goals and objectives.
	Customer Service Orientation: Commitment to delivering exceptional customer service to both internal and external stakeholders.
	Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities
	Leadership Skills: Ability to lead and motivate self and others, and inspire colleagues to perform at their best in delivering top-quality services.
	Confidentiality: Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise extreme discretion


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: g.nwogwor@bildiamo.com ,  o.oseikhuemen@bildiamo.com , j.omefe@bildiamo.com and admin@bildiamo.com using “Application for Cost Accountant” as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Accountant / Account Officer

Job Location: Sangotedo, Eti-Osa - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Accountant will oversee the financial operations of the Resturant, ensuring accurate financial reporting, compliance with relevant regulations, and the effective management of financial processes.
	This role is critical in supporting the business’s financial health and operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee and manage all financial operations of the Resturant
	Ensure accurate recording and tracking of financial transactions within the company’s accounting system.
	Prepare, analyze, and present financial statements and reports to management.
	Ensure compliance with financial policies, tax regulations, and statutory requirements.
	Manage payroll processing, including statutory deductions and prompt remittance of VAT, PAYE, and Consumption Tax.
	Handle service charge processing, deductions, and reporting.
	Conduct month-end inventory counts and reconcile discrepancies.
	Supervise and guide Account Assistants in their daily tasks to ensure efficiency and accuracy.
	Follow up on collections across all payment channels, including POS, bank transfers, cash, and other payment methods, and handle customer refunds as necessary.
	Manage recipes, menu items, and inventory data within the company’s accounting system to ensure accurate cost tracking and inventory valuation.
	Implement and maintain robust internal controls over financial transactions and reporting processes.
	Reconcile bank statements and manage accounts payable and receivable using the company’s accounting system.
	Perform any other assignments or special projects as assigned by the Group Head of Accounts or the CFO.


Skills, Attributes, and Competencies


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	3-5 years of experience in accounting, preferably within the hospitality or service industry.
	Professional qualification such as ACA, ACCA, or equivalent (preferred).
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, tax regulations, and statutory compliance requirements.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel.
	Excellent analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong sense of integrity and professionalism.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: g.nwogwor@bildiamo.com , j.omefe@bildiamo.com and admin@bildiamo.com using “Application for Accountant/Account Officer” as the subject of the email.

Note: Interested Candidate must resides around Ajah-Sangotedo axis.

 

 

3.) Quality Control Officer

Job Location: Sangotedo, Eti-Osa - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	A Quality Control Officer is responsible for ensuring that products or services meet established quality standards and specifications by monitoring, inspecting, and testing production processes and outputs.


Job Brief


	As a Quality Control Officer, you will assess product or service quality, identify defects or deviations from standards, and implement corrective actions to maintain or improve quality levels. Your role involves performing inspections, audits, and tests to verify compliance with quality requirements and customer expectations.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement quality control processes, procedures, and guidelines to ensure consistency, reliability, and compliance with quality standards and regulations.
	Conduct inspections and audits of production processes, materials, components, and finished products or services to identify quality issues, defects, or non-conformities.
	Review specifications, blueprints, and technical documents to understand quality requirements, tolerances, and acceptance criteria for products or services.
	Perform visual inspections, measurements, and tests using precision tools, equipment, and instruments to verify product dimensions, appearance, and functionality.
	Collect and analyze quality data, metrics, and performance indicators to evaluate process capabilities, identify trends, and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
	Document and report quality findings, deviations, and corrective actions taken, maintaining accurate records, logs, and inspection reports for traceability and accountability.
	Collaborate with production teams, engineers, and suppliers to address quality issues, resolve discrepancies, and implement corrective and preventive actions (CAPAs) to prevent recurrence.
	Conduct root cause analysis and problem-solving activities to identify underlying causes of quality issues, applying techniques such as 5 Whys, fishbone diagrams, and Pareto analysis.
	Monitor adherence to quality standards, work instructions, and regulatory requirements throughout the production process, ensuring compliance with ISO, FDA, or industry-specific quality standards.
	Train and educate production staff on quality control processes, procedures, and best practices, fostering a culture of quality awareness, accountability, and continuous improvement.
	Participate in product development and validation activities, providing input on design reviews, risk assessments, and validation protocols to ensure product quality and reliability.
	Coordinate with external auditors, customers, and regulatory agencies during quality audits, inspections, or certifications, providing documentation and support as needed.
	Conduct supplier quality assessments and inspections, evaluating supplier performance, capabilities, and adherence to quality standards, and communicating feedback to suppliers.
	Implement quality assurance tools and techniques, such as statistical process control (SPC), Six Sigma, or lean manufacturing principles, to monitor and improve process performance and product quality.
	Stay updated on industry trends, regulatory changes, and advancements in quality management practices, participating in training programs, seminars, and professional development activities.


Requirements and Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, quality management, industrial technology, or a related field; professional certification in quality management (e.g., ASQ CQE, CQM) is a plus with 3-5 years experience.
	Proven experience in quality control, quality assurance, or quality management roles, preferably in a manufacturing or production environment.
	Knowledge of quality management principles, methodologies, and tools, such as ISO 9001, Six Sigma, Total Quality Management (TQM), and statistical analysis techniques.
	Familiarity with quality standards, regulations, and requirements applicable to the industry, such as FDA regulations, ISO standards, and customer-specific quality requirements.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze data, identify trends, and implement corrective actions to improve quality and process performance.
	Attention to detail and accuracy in performing inspections, measurements, and tests, ensuring compliance with quality specifications and acceptance criteria.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, suppliers, and customers to resolve quality issues.
	Proficiency in using quality control tools and software, such as statistical analysis software, quality management systems (QMS), and document control systems.
	Leadership and teamwork abilities, with the capacity to lead quality improvement projects, train and mentor team members, and foster a culture of quality excellence.
	Adaptability and flexibility to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities and responding to changing business needs and customer requirements.


Required Skills:


	Quality control
	Inspection techniques
	Problem-solving abilities
	Statistical analysis
	Communication skills
	Attention to detail
	Teamwork
	Quality management systems
	Analytical skills
	Adaptability


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: g.nwogwor@bildiamo.com , j.omefe@bildiamo.com, admin@bildiamo.com using “Application for Quality Control Officer” as the subject of the email.

Note: Interested candidate must resides around Ajah-Sangotedo axis.    

    

        Click here to Apply
